00074 #ifndef CONSTRAINT_OCCURRENCE_H
00075 #define CONSTRAINT_OCCURRENCE_H
00076 
00077 // Negated occurrence; used in reverse_constraint for OccurrenceEqualConstraint
00078 template<typename VarArray, typename Val, typename ValCount>
00079 struct NotOccurrenceEqualConstraint : public AbstractConstraint
00080 {
00081   virtual string constraint_name()
00082   { return "NotOccurrenceEqual"; }
00083 
00084   typedef typename VarArray::value_type VarRef;
00085 
00086   ReversibleInt occurrences_count;
00087   ReversibleInt not_occurrences_count;
00088   VarArray var_array;
00089 
00090   ValCount val_count;
00091   Val value;
00092 
00093   NotOccurrenceEqualConstraint(StateObj* _stateObj, const VarArray& _var_array, const Val& _value, const ValCount& _val_count) :
00094     AbstractConstraint(_stateObj), occurrences_count(_stateObj), not_occurrences_count(_stateObj),
00095     var_array(_var_array), val_count(_val_count), value(_value), trigger1index(-1), trigger2index(-1)
00096   { }
00097 
00098   // Put two assignment triggers on the vector, and one on val_count.
00099   // When all vars in X are assigned, remove count(X=v) from val_count
00100 
00101   // When val_count is assigned and all but one of the vector are assigned,
00102   // consider the remaining one in the vector, and either fix it to v or
00103   // remove v from its domain to avoid the value of val_count.
00104 
00105   int dynamic_trigger_count()
00106   { // two moving assignment triggers.
00107     return 2;
00108   }
00109 
00110   virtual triggerCollection setup_internal()
00111   {
00112     triggerCollection t;
00113     t.push_back(make_trigger(val_count, Trigger(this, -1), Assigned));
00114     return t;
00115   }
00116 
00117   virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int v_size)
00118   {
00119     D_ASSERT(v_size == var_array.size() + 1);
00120     DomainInt count = 0;
00121     for(int i = 0; i < v_size - 1; ++i)
00122       count += (*(v + i) == value);
00123     return count != *(v + v_size - 1);
00124   }
00125 
00126   virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
00127   {
00128     vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
00129     vars.reserve(var_array.size() + 1);
00130     for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00131       vars.push_back(AnyVarRef(var_array[i]));
00132     vars.push_back(AnyVarRef(val_count));
00133     return vars;
00134   }
00135 
00136 
00137   virtual void propagate(int z, DomainDelta)
00138   {
00139       // val_count has been assigned.
00140       D_ASSERT(z==-1);
00141       DynamicTrigger* dt = dynamic_trigger_start();
00142       if(trigger1index==-1 || var_array[trigger1index].isAssigned())
00143       {
00144           trigger1index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(-1, trigger1index, dt);
00145           if(trigger1index==-1)
00146           {
00147               valcount_assigned();
00148               return;
00149           }
00150       }
00151       if(trigger2index==-1 || var_array[trigger2index].isAssigned())
00152       {
00153           trigger2index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(trigger1index, trigger2index, dt+1);
00154           if(trigger2index==-1)
00155           {
00156               valcount_assigned();
00157               return;
00158           }
00159       }
00160   }
00161 
00162   virtual void propagate(DynamicTrigger* trig)
00163   {
00164       DynamicTrigger* dt = dynamic_trigger_start();
00165       if(trig==dt || trigger1index==-1)
00166       {
00167           if(val_count.isAssigned())
00168           {
00169               // make sure both triggers are in place.
00170               trigger1index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(-1, trigger1index, dt);
00171               if(trigger1index==-1)
00172               {
00173                   valcount_assigned();
00174                   return;
00175               }
00176               if(trigger2index==-1 || var_array[trigger2index].isAssigned())
00177               {
00178                   trigger2index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(trigger1index, trigger2index, dt+1);
00179                   if(trigger2index==-1)
00180                   {
00181                       valcount_assigned();
00182                       return;
00183                   }
00184               }
00185           }
00186           else
00187           {
00188               trigger1index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(-1, trigger1index, dt);
00189               if(trigger1index==-1)
00190               {
00191                   vector_assigned();
00192                   return;
00193               }
00194           }
00195           return;
00196       }
00197       D_ASSERT(trig==dt+1);
00198       if(!val_count.isAssigned())
00199       {   // don't need two triggers.
00200           releaseTrigger(stateObj, trig);
00201           trigger2index=-1;
00202           return;
00203       }
00204 
00205       if(var_array[trigger1index].isAssigned())
00206       {
00207           // just wait for the other trigger, then both triggers will be repositioned. lazy coding!
00208           return;
00209       }
00210 
00211       trigger2index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(trigger1index, trigger2index, dt+1);
00212       if(trigger2index==-1)
00213       {
00214           valcount_assigned();
00215       }
00216   }
00217 
00218   // unfinished new stuff starts here.
00219 
00220   int watch_unassigned_in_vector(int avoidindex, int oldsupport, DynamicTrigger* dt)
00221   {
00222       // move dt to an index other than avoidindex, or return -1.
00223       int newsupport=oldsupport+1;
00224       for( ; newsupport<var_array.size(); newsupport++)
00225       {
00226           if(newsupport!=avoidindex)
00227           {
00228               if(!var_array[newsupport].isAssigned())
00229               {
00230                   var_array[newsupport].addDynamicTrigger(dt, Assigned);
00231                   return newsupport;
00232               }
00233           }
00234       }
00235 
00236       for(newsupport=0; newsupport<=oldsupport; newsupport++)
00237       {
00238           if(newsupport!=avoidindex)
00239           {
00240               if(!var_array[newsupport].isAssigned())
00241               {
00242                   var_array[newsupport].addDynamicTrigger(dt, Assigned);
00243                   return newsupport;
00244               }
00245           }
00246       }
00247       return -1;
00248   }
00249 
00250   int trigger1index;
00251   int trigger2index;
00252 
00253   void vector_assigned()
00254   {
00255       // count occurrences of val
00256       int occ=0;
00257       for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00258       {
00259           if(var_array[i].getAssignedValue()==value)
00260               occ++;
00261       }
00262       if(val_count.inDomain(occ))
00263       {
00264           val_count.removeFromDomain(occ);
00265       }
00266   }
00267 
00268   void valcount_assigned()
00269   {
00270       // valcount, and all but one (or all) of the vector, are assigned.
00271       // count occurrences of val
00272       int occ=0;
00273       int unassigned=-1;
00274       D_ASSERT(val_count.isAssigned());
00275       for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00276       {
00277           if(var_array[i].isAssigned())
00278           {
00279               if(var_array[i].getAssignedValue()==value)
00280               {
00281                   occ++;
00282               }
00283           }
00284           else
00285           {
00286               D_ASSERT(unassigned==-1);
00287               unassigned=i;
00288           }
00289       }
00290 
00291       // and the rest.
00292       if(unassigned==-1)
00293       {
00294           // just check, everything is assigned.
00295           if(occ==val_count.getAssignedValue())
00296           {
00297               getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00298           }
00299       }
00300       else
00301       {
00302           if(occ==val_count.getAssignedValue())
00303           { // need another occurrence of the value
00304               var_array[unassigned].propagateAssign(value);
00305           }
00306           else if(occ+1 == val_count.getAssignedValue())
00307           { // not allowed to have another value.
00308               var_array[unassigned].removeFromDomain(value);
00309           }
00310       }
00311   }
00312 
00313   virtual void full_propagate()
00314   {
00315     DynamicTrigger* dt = dynamic_trigger_start();
00316     trigger1index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(-1, -1, dt);
00317     if(trigger1index==-1)
00318     {
00319         vector_assigned();
00320         return;
00321     }
00322 
00323     if(val_count.isAssigned())
00324     {
00325         // watch a second place in the vector.
00326         trigger2index=watch_unassigned_in_vector(trigger1index, trigger1index, dt+1);
00327         if(trigger2index==-1)
00328         {
00329             valcount_assigned();
00330             return;
00331         }
00332     }
00333   }
00334 
00335    // Getting a satisfying assignment here is too hard, we don't want to have to
00336    // build a matching.
00337   virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
00338   {
00339     MAKE_STACK_BOX(c, DomainInt, var_array.size() + 1);
00340 
00341     for(int i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00342     {
00343       if(!var_array[i].isAssigned())
00344       {
00345         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, var_array[i].getMin()));
00346         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, var_array[i].getMax()));
00347         return true;
00348       }
00349       else
00350         c.push_back(var_array[i].getAssignedValue());
00351     }
00352 
00353     if(!val_count.isAssigned())
00354     {
00355       assignment.push_back(make_pair(var_array.size(), val_count.getMin()));
00356       assignment.push_back(make_pair(var_array.size(), val_count.getMax()));
00357       return true;
00358     }
00359     else
00360       c.push_back(val_count.getAssignedValue());
00361 
00362     if(check_assignment(c.begin(), c.size()))
00363     {  // Put the complete assignment in the box.
00364       for(int i = 0; i < var_array.size() + 1; ++i)
00365         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, c[i]));
00366       return true;
00367     }
00368     return false;
00369   }
00370 };
00371 
00372 template<typename VarArray, typename Val>
00373 struct ConstantOccurrenceEqualConstraint : public AbstractConstraint
00374 {
00375   virtual string constraint_name()
00376   { return "OccurrenceLeq/Geq"; }
00377 
00378   typedef typename VarArray::value_type VarRef;
00379 
00380   ReversibleInt occurrences_count;
00381   ReversibleInt not_occurrences_count;
00382   VarArray var_array;
00383 
00384   int val_count_min;
00385   int val_count_max;
00386   Val value;
00387 
00388   ConstantOccurrenceEqualConstraint(StateObj* _stateObj, const VarArray& _var_array, const Val& _value,
00389                             int _val_count_min, int _val_count_max) :
00390     AbstractConstraint(_stateObj), occurrences_count(_stateObj), not_occurrences_count(_stateObj),
00391     var_array(_var_array), val_count_min(_val_count_min), val_count_max(_val_count_max), value(_value)
00392   { }
00393 
00394   virtual triggerCollection setup_internal()
00395   {
00396     triggerCollection t;
00397     occurrences_count = 0;
00398     not_occurrences_count = 0;
00399     for(unsigned int i=0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00400       t.push_back(make_trigger(var_array[i], Trigger(this, i), Assigned));
00401     return t;
00402   }
00403 
00404   void occurrence_limit_reached()
00405   {
00406     D_ASSERT(val_count_max <= occurrences_count);
00407     int occs = 0;
00408     typename VarArray::iterator end_it(var_array.end());
00409     for(typename VarArray::iterator it=var_array.begin(); it < end_it; ++it)
00410     {
00411       if(it->isAssigned())
00412       {
00413         if(it->getAssignedValue() == value)
00414         ++occs;
00415       }
00416       else
00417       {
00418         it->removeFromDomain(value);
00419       }
00420     }
00421     if(val_count_max < occs)
00422       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00423   }
00424 
00425   void not_occurrence_limit_reached()
00426   {
00427     D_ASSERT(not_occurrences_count >= static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - val_count_min);
00428     int occs = 0;
00429     typename VarArray::iterator end_it(var_array.end());
00430     for( typename VarArray::iterator it=var_array.begin(); it < end_it; ++it)
00431     {
00432       if(it->isAssigned())
00433       {
00434       if(it->getAssignedValue() != value)
00435         ++occs;
00436       }
00437       else
00438       { it->propagateAssign(value); }
00439     }
00440     if(val_count_min > static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - occs)
00441       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00442   }
00443 
00444   virtual void propagate(int i, DomainDelta)
00445   {
00446       PROP_INFO_ADDONE(OccEqual);
00447     D_ASSERT(i >= 0);
00448 
00449     if( var_array[i].getAssignedValue() == value )
00450     {
00451       ++occurrences_count;
00452       if(val_count_max < occurrences_count)
00453         getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00454       if(occurrences_count == val_count_max)
00455         occurrence_limit_reached();
00456     }
00457     else
00458     {
00459       ++not_occurrences_count;
00460       if(val_count_min > static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - not_occurrences_count)
00461         getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00462       if(not_occurrences_count == static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - val_count_min )
00463         not_occurrence_limit_reached();
00464     }
00465   }
00466 
00467   void setup_counters()
00468   {
00469     int occs = 0;
00470       int not_occs = 0;
00471     typename VarArray::iterator end_it(var_array.end());
00472     for(typename VarArray::iterator it=var_array.begin(); it < end_it; ++it)
00473     {
00474       if(it->isAssigned())
00475         {
00476         if(it->getAssignedValue() == value)
00477           ++occs;
00478           else
00479           ++not_occs;
00480       }
00481     }
00482     occurrences_count = occs;
00483       not_occurrences_count = not_occs;
00484   }
00485 
00486   virtual void full_propagate()
00487   {
00488     if(val_count_max < 0 || val_count_min > (int)var_array.size())
00489       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00490     setup_counters();
00491 
00492     if(val_count_max < occurrences_count)
00493       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00494 
00495     if(val_count_min > static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - not_occurrences_count)
00496       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00497 
00498     if(occurrences_count == val_count_max)
00499       occurrence_limit_reached();
00500     if(not_occurrences_count == static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - val_count_min)
00501       not_occurrence_limit_reached();
00502   }
00503 
00504   virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int v_size)
00505   {
00506     D_ASSERT(v_size == var_array.size());
00507     DomainInt count = 0;
00508     for(int i = 0; i < v_size; ++i)
00509       count += (*(v + i) == value);
00510     return (count >= val_count_min) && (count <= val_count_max);
00511   }
00512 
00513   virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
00514   {
00515     vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
00516       vars.reserve(var_array.size());
00517       for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00518         vars.push_back(AnyVarRef(var_array[i]));
00519       return vars;
00520   }
00521 
00522    // Getting a satisfying assignment here is too hard, we don't want to have to
00523    // build a matching.
00524   virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
00525   {
00526     MAKE_STACK_BOX(c, DomainInt, var_array.size());
00527 
00528     for(int i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00529     {
00530       if(!var_array[i].isAssigned())
00531       {
00532         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, var_array[i].getMin()));
00533         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, var_array[i].getMax()));
00534         return true;
00535       }
00536       else
00537         c.push_back(var_array[i].getAssignedValue());
00538     }
00539 
00540     if(check_assignment(c.begin(), c.size()))
00541     {  // Put the complete assignment in the box.
00542       for(int i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00543         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, c[i]));
00544       return true;
00545     }
00546     return false;
00547   }
00548 
00549   AbstractConstraint* reverse_constraint()
00550   {
00551       // This constraint actually constrains the occurrences of value to an an interval
00552       // [val_count_min, val_count_max]. But it's apparently only used for less-than
00553       // and greater-than. So identify the less-than case and make a greater-than, etc.
00554       if(val_count_min==0)
00555       {
00556           return new ConstantOccurrenceEqualConstraint<VarArray, Val>(stateObj, var_array, value, val_count_max+1, var_array.size());
00557       }
00558       if(val_count_max==var_array.size())
00559       {
00560           return new ConstantOccurrenceEqualConstraint<VarArray, Val>(stateObj, var_array, value, 0, val_count_min-1);
00561       }
00562       FAIL_EXIT("Unable to negate an occurrence-interval constraint, sorry.");
00563       return NULL;
00564   }
00565 };
00566 
00567 template<typename VarArray, typename Val, typename ValCount>
00568 struct OccurrenceEqualConstraint : public AbstractConstraint
00569 {
00570   virtual string constraint_name()
00571   { return "OccurrenceEqual"; }
00572 
00573   typedef typename VarArray::value_type VarRef;
00574 
00575   ReversibleInt occurrences_count;
00576   ReversibleInt not_occurrences_count;
00577   VarArray var_array;
00578 
00579   ValCount val_count;
00580   Val value;
00581 
00582   OccurrenceEqualConstraint(StateObj* _stateObj, const VarArray& _var_array, const Val& _value, const ValCount& _val_count) :
00583     AbstractConstraint(_stateObj), occurrences_count(_stateObj), not_occurrences_count(_stateObj),
00584     var_array(_var_array), val_count(_val_count), value(_value)
00585   { }
00586 
00587   virtual triggerCollection setup_internal()
00588   {
00589     triggerCollection t;
00590     occurrences_count = 0;
00591     not_occurrences_count = 0;
00592     for(unsigned int i=0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00593       t.push_back(make_trigger(var_array[i], Trigger(this, i), Assigned));
00594     t.push_back(make_trigger(val_count, Trigger(this, -1), UpperBound));
00595     t.push_back(make_trigger(val_count, Trigger(this, -2), LowerBound));
00596     return t;
00597   }
00598 
00599   void occurrence_limit_reached()
00600   {
00601     D_ASSERT(val_count.getMax() <= occurrences_count);
00602     int occs = 0;
00603     typename VarArray::iterator end_it(var_array.end());
00604     for(typename VarArray::iterator it=var_array.begin(); it < end_it; ++it)
00605     {
00606       if(it->isAssigned())
00607       {
00608         if(it->getAssignedValue() == value)
00609         ++occs;
00610       }
00611       else
00612       {
00613         it->removeFromDomain(value);
00614       }
00615     }
00616     val_count.setMin(occs);
00617   }
00618 
00619   void not_occurrence_limit_reached()
00620   {
00621     D_ASSERT(not_occurrences_count >= static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - val_count.getMin());
00622     int occs = 0;
00623     typename VarArray::iterator end_it(var_array.end());
00624     for( typename VarArray::iterator it=var_array.begin(); it < end_it; ++it)
00625     {
00626       if(it->isAssigned())
00627       {
00628       if(it->getAssignedValue() != value)
00629         ++occs;
00630       }
00631       else
00632       { it->propagateAssign(value); }
00633     }
00634     val_count.setMax(static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - occs);
00635   }
00636 
00637   virtual void propagate(int i, DomainDelta)
00638   {
00639     PROP_INFO_ADDONE(OccEqual);
00640     if(i < 0)
00641     { // val_count changed
00642       if(occurrences_count == val_count.getMax())
00643         occurrence_limit_reached();
00644       if(not_occurrences_count == static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - val_count.getMin() )
00645         not_occurrence_limit_reached();
00646       return;
00647     }
00648 
00649     if( var_array[i].getAssignedValue() == value )
00650     {
00651       ++occurrences_count;
00652       val_count.setMin(occurrences_count);
00653       if(occurrences_count == val_count.getMax())
00654         occurrence_limit_reached();
00655     }
00656     else
00657     {
00658       ++not_occurrences_count;
00659       val_count.setMax(static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - not_occurrences_count);
00660       if(not_occurrences_count == static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - val_count.getMin() )
00661         not_occurrence_limit_reached();
00662     }
00663   }
00664 
00665   void setup_counters()
00666   {
00667     int occs = 0;
00668     int not_occs = 0;
00669     typename VarArray::iterator end_it(var_array.end());
00670     for(typename VarArray::iterator it=var_array.begin(); it < end_it; ++it)
00671     {
00672       if(it->isAssigned())
00673       {
00674         if(it->getAssignedValue() == value)
00675           ++occs;
00676         else
00677           ++not_occs;
00678       }
00679     }
00680     occurrences_count = occs;
00681     not_occurrences_count = not_occs;
00682   }
00683 
00684   virtual void full_propagate()
00685   {
00686     val_count.setMin(0);
00687     val_count.setMax(var_array.size());
00688     setup_counters();
00689     val_count.setMin(occurrences_count);
00690     val_count.setMax(static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - not_occurrences_count);
00691 
00692     if(occurrences_count == val_count.getMax())
00693       occurrence_limit_reached();
00694     if(not_occurrences_count == static_cast<int>(var_array.size()) - val_count.getMin() )
00695       not_occurrence_limit_reached();
00696   }
00697 
00698   virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int v_size)
00699   {
00700     D_ASSERT(v_size == var_array.size() + 1);
00701     DomainInt count = 0;
00702     for(int i = 0; i < v_size - 1; ++i)
00703       count += (*(v + i) == value);
00704     return count == *(v + v_size - 1);
00705   }
00706 
00707   virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
00708   {
00709     vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
00710     vars.reserve(var_array.size() + 1);
00711     for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00712       vars.push_back(AnyVarRef(var_array[i]));
00713     vars.push_back(AnyVarRef(val_count));
00714     return vars;
00715   }
00716 
00717    // Getting a satisfying assignment here is too hard, we don't want to have to
00718    // build a matching.
00719   virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
00720   {
00721     MAKE_STACK_BOX(c, DomainInt, var_array.size() + 1);
00722 
00723     for(int i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
00724     {
00725       if(!var_array[i].isAssigned())
00726       {
00727         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, var_array[i].getMin()));
00728         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, var_array[i].getMax()));
00729         return true;
00730       }
00731       else
00732         c.push_back(var_array[i].getAssignedValue());
00733     }
00734 
00735     if(!val_count.isAssigned())
00736     {
00737       assignment.push_back(make_pair(var_array.size(), val_count.getMin()));
00738       assignment.push_back(make_pair(var_array.size(), val_count.getMax()));
00739       return true;
00740     }
00741     else
00742       c.push_back(val_count.getAssignedValue());
00743 
00744 
00745     if(check_assignment(c.begin(), c.size()))
00746     {  // Put the complete assignment in the box.
00747       for(int i = 0; i < var_array.size() + 1; ++i)
00748         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, c[i]));
00749       return true;
00750     }
00751     return false;
00752   }
00753 
00754   AbstractConstraint* reverse_constraint()
00755   {
00756       return new NotOccurrenceEqualConstraint<VarArray, Val, ValCount>(stateObj, var_array, value, val_count);
00757       /*vector<AnyVarRef> v;
00758       for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00759       {
00760           v.push_back((AnyVarRef) var_array[i]);
00761       }
00762       v.push_back(val_count);
00763       return new ForwardCheckingConstraint<vector<AnyVarRef>, FCNotOccurrence>(stateObj, v, value);*/
00764   }
00765 };

00768 
00769 template<typename VarArray, typename Val, typename ValCount>
00770 AbstractConstraint*
00771 OccEqualCon(StateObj* stateObj, const VarArray& _var_array,  const Val& _value, const ValCount& _val_count)
00772 {
00773   return
00774   (new OccurrenceEqualConstraint<VarArray,Val, ValCount>(stateObj, _var_array,  _value, _val_count));
00775 }
00776 
00777 template<typename VarArray, typename Val>
00778 AbstractConstraint*
00779 ConstantOccEqualCon(StateObj* stateObj, const VarArray& _var_array,  const Val& _value, int _val_count_min, int _val_count_max)
00780 {
00781   return
00782   (new ConstantOccurrenceEqualConstraint<VarArray,Val>(stateObj, _var_array,  _value, _val_count_min, _val_count_max));
00783 }
00784 
00785 template<typename T1, typename T3>
00786 AbstractConstraint*
00787 BuildCT_OCCURRENCE(StateObj* stateObj, const T1& t1, const T3& t3, ConstraintBlob& b)
00788 {
00789   int val_to_count = b.constants[0][0];
00790   return OccEqualCon(stateObj, t1, runtime_val(val_to_count), t3[0]);
00791 }
00792 
00793 template<typename T1>
00794 AbstractConstraint*
00795 BuildCT_LEQ_OCCURRENCE(StateObj* stateObj, const T1& t1, ConstraintBlob& b)
00796 {
00797   int val_to_count = b.constants[0][0];
00798   int occs = b.constants[1][0];
00799   return ConstantOccEqualCon(stateObj, t1, runtime_val(val_to_count), 0, occs);
00800  }
00801 
00802 template<typename T1>
00803 AbstractConstraint*
00804 BuildCT_GEQ_OCCURRENCE(StateObj* stateObj, const T1& t1, ConstraintBlob& b)
00805 {
00806   int val_to_count = b.constants[0][0];
00807   int occs = b.constants[1][0];
00808   { return ConstantOccEqualCon(stateObj, t1, runtime_val(val_to_count), occs, t1.size()); }
00809 }
